item.title: Australia Divided on DeepSeek Response: Industry Groups Call for Action, Minister Urges Caution
item.description:
Australian authorities disagree over the response the country should take to the runaway success of the Chinese AI app DeepSeek.

Go to Source

item.title: DeepSeek, AppleCare, and Did Apple Approve a Porn App in the EU?
item.description:
A change may be coming in the way you’ll be paying for Apple Care. Apple doesn’t approve of an app that it has approved—semantics are at the heart of a porn app problem. DeepSeek is this past week’s big artificial intelligence story. What’s different about this new AI contender? Does it secure your data? And Apple’s new Invites app doesn’t seem to be too inviting.

The post DeepSeek, AppleCare, and Did Apple Approve a Porn App in the EU? appeared first on The Mac Security Blog.

item.title: DeepSeek Locked Down Public Database Access That Exposed Chat History
item.description:
Research Firm Wiz Research began investigating DeepSeek soon after its generative AI took the tech world by storm.

Go to Source

item.title: DeepSeek Chatbot Beats OpenAI on App Store Leaderboard
item.description:
The Chinese firm said it cost just $5.6 million to train a model that can reason through complex answers and compete with OpenAI’s o1.
